 PREV   NEXT FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Uses of Package
net.jxta.content

Packages that use net.jxta.content
net.jxta.content Content objects are container objects that can hold arbitrary data and are associated with a JXTA ID (replacing the older Codat API). 
net.jxta.id IDs are used within JXTA to refer to peers, peer groups, pipes and other types of resources. 
net.jxta.impl.content   
net.jxta.impl.content.defprovider Implementation of the ContentProviderSPI which uses a custom, lightweight, easy to implement, but relatively slow protocol to transfer Content. 
net.jxta.impl.content.srdisocket Implementation of the ContentProviderSPI which uses the JxtaSocket API to provide Content transfer capabilities. 
net.jxta.impl.id.UUID The 'uuid' format is a general purpose JXTA ID Format. 
net.jxta.impl.id.binaryID The 'binary' format is a general purpose JXTA ID Format. 
net.jxta.impl.peergroup Provides the standard JXTA Peer Group implementations as well as legacy peer group configuration functionality. 
net.jxta.peergroup Peer groups are formed as a collection of peers that have agreed upon a common set of services. 
net.jxta.protocol Provides inteface objects for Advertisments and protocol messages for the JXTA Core and Standard Protocols. 
 

Classes in net.jxta.content used by net.jxta.content
Content
          The common container for managing content (arbitrary binary data) within JXTA.
ContentID
          An identifier that enables canonical references to be made to a Content instance within the context of a specific peer group.
ContentProvider
          ContentProvider implementations define a single methodology and/or protocol to obtain content from a (potentially) remote data source.
ContentProviderEvent
          ContentProvider event object containing information related to the event being published.
ContentProviderEvent.Builder
          Builder pattern.
ContentProviderListener
          Interface provided to notify interested parties of ContentProvider events which may be useful to them.
ContentProviderSPI
          Service provider interface used to define new implementations of ContentProvider search and transfer mechanism.
ContentShare
          ContentShare objects represent the server / data provider portion of a Content transfer mechanism.
ContentShareEvent
          ContentShare event object, containing information related to the event being published.
ContentShareEvent.Builder
          Builder pattern.
ContentShareListener
          This interface should expose events which should be common to most/all implementations and which provide information relevant to allowing the application a mechanism by which to inform the end user of the share activity.
ContentSourceLocationState
          Enumeration used to represent the remote source location status provided by TransferListener events.
ContentTransfer
          ContentTransfer objects represent the client / requesting side of a Content transfer mechanism.
ContentTransferAggregator
          This interface represents a content transfer which is acting as a front for multiple ContentTransfer instances, all of which are working to obtain a single Content instance.
ContentTransferAggregatorEvent
          ContentTransfer event object, containing information related to the event being published.
ContentTransferAggregatorEvent.Builder
          Builder pattern.
ContentTransferAggregatorListener
          Listener interface used for monitoring changes of state within a ContentTransferAggregator instance.
ContentTransferEvent
          ContentTransfer event object, containing information related to the event being published.
ContentTransferEvent.Builder
          Builder pattern.
ContentTransferListener
          Listener interface used for monitoring the progress of a Content transfer.
ContentTransferState
          Enumeration used to represent the transfer state provided by TransferListener events.
TransferException
          Base exception for representing terminal Content transfer problems.
 

Classes in net.jxta.content used by net.jxta.id
ContentID
          An identifier that enables canonical references to be made to a Content instance within the context of a specific peer group.
